intro: Schoenoplectiella triangulata, commonly known as the triangular sedge, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia, particularly China. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stem and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Schoenoplectiella triangulata is often found in wetlands and marshy areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
